title: How to Make a Multi Deck Pancake Sandwich Stack

steps.headline: Make the pancakes if you haven't already done so.
steps.description: The trick is to keep them all to an even size and not too large. Suggested width of your pancakes is 15cm (6 inches), and of a good thickness. Allow to cool.

steps.headline: Place the first pancake on the serving plate.
Spread the first topping or filling.
steps.description: Add a new pancake on the top.

steps.headline: Add the next topping or filling.
steps.description: Continue until you have a steady and reasonably tall stack. A reasonable sandwich stack will consist of about 4-6 pancakes. If it's too high, it risks toppling and is a whole lot harder to eat.

methods.name: Turn It Into a Meal Game

steps.headline: Give every diner a pancake.
steps.description: Ask them to choose their favorite spread. Give each person a clean knife.

steps.headline: Place the first pancake on the serving plate.
steps.description: Pass the plate around and ask each person to add their spread. They then add the next pancake level.

steps.headline: Continue until the stack is made.
steps.description: If there are too many people dining and the stack is getting too high, simply create a few "teams" and make separate stacks. These can still be shared around with everyone.

methods.name: Serving the Multi Deck Pancake Sandwich Stack

steps.headline: Cut the sandwich stack like you would cut a cake.
Place a slice on each plate.
steps.description: It should sit nicely longways across the plate.

steps.headline: Add a dollop of ice cream, whipped cream, yogurt or maple syrup.

text: Steps Make the pancakes if you haven't already done so. The trick is to keep them all to an even size and not too large. Suggested width of your pancakes is 15cm (6 inches), and of a good thickness. Allow to cool. Place the first pancake on the serving plate.  Spread the first topping or filling. Add a new pancake on the top. Add the next topping or filling. Continue until you have a steady and reasonably tall stack. A reasonable sandwich stack will consist of about 4-6 pancakes. If it's too high, it risks toppling and is a whole lot harder to eat. Turn It Into a Meal Game Give every diner a pancake. Ask them to choose their favorite spread. Give each person a clean knife. Place the first pancake on the serving plate. Pass the plate around and ask each person to add their spread. They then add the next pancake level. Continue until the stack is made. If there are too many people dining and the stack is getting too high, simply create a few "teams" and make separate stacks. These can still be shared around with everyone. Serving the Multi Deck Pancake Sandwich Stack Cut the sandwich stack like you would cut a cake.  Place a slice on each plate. It should sit nicely longways across the plate. Add a dollop of ice cream, whipped cream, yogurt or maple syrup. It's ready to devour! Finished.
